page.title: 02Chatteris - Drainage History
page.content: We found out that the Fens around Chatteris used to be swamps covered with reeds. Groups of people lived on the little gravel islands which stuck up out of the bog. The people grazed their cattle on the islands and dug peat out of the bogs to burn in the winter. The Romans came and tried to drain the area and so did the Nuns who founded the Abbey in Chatteris, they did not succeed and the Fens stayed mostly under water. In 1630 the Dutchman, Cornelius Vermuyden, came to drain the area and in 1650 the Sixteen and Forty Foot drains which drain our section of Chatteris were cut. We found out that the numbers tell us how wide the drains are, and that they have not changed very much since they were first dug.
